sentence: The U.S. stock market was in the green in premarket trading Friday, ending the week higher.
Shares of General Electric Co. ( GE ), however, were down on the back of the company reporting financial results for its third quarter.
EPS of 29 cents missed expectations by 20 cents, but revenue of $33.47 billion beat estimates by $910 million and gained 14.3% year over year.
The main European stock markets traded mostly higher.
The U.K.'s FTSE 100 gained 0.19 points, France's CAC 40 inched up 0.07% and Spain's IBEX 35 climbed 0.15%.

Only Germany's DAX was lower, falling 0.04%

In Asia, Japan's Nikkei 225 rose 0.04%, China's Shanghai Composite was up 0.25% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng gained 1.17%.
Disclosure : The author holds no positions in any stocks mentioned.
This article first appeared on GuruFocus .
